text: African Review was a magazine published by the government of Kwame Nkrumah in Ghana. Prominent contributors have included Maya Angelou and Jean Carey Bond (at the same time her husband Max Bond worked as an architect for Nrumah). Artwork in the magazine included work by Tom Feelings. Julian Mayfield was the first editor of the magazine. The University of Cambridge has archived editions. A monthly magazine it was launched at a time of revolutions and protests. ==References== Category:Ghanaian society Category:Nkrumaism Category:Magazines published in Africa
title: African Review
